What is the purpose of the `OPTION_NATIVE_CURRENCY` flag in PBaaS chain definitions?
There is no `OPTION_NATIVE_CURRENCY` flag in PBaaS chain definitions.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
Can you explain how the `OPTION_PBAAS` flag is used to restrict a PBaaS chain to a single currency?

The `OPTION_PBAAS` flag is not used to restrict a PBaaS chain to a single currency. It is actually used to indicate that a chain definition is a PBaaS chain. The `OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY` flag is the one that can be used to potentially restrict a PBaaS chain or gateway to a single currency.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
What is the purpose of the `OPTION_NFT` flag in token definitions?

There is no `OPTION_NFT` flag in token definitions. Instead, there is an `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN` flag, which is used to create a single satoshi NFT token that tokenizes control over the root ID. This flag is not a general `OPTION_NFT` flag, but a specific flag for creating a particular type of NFT token.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
